alert.note: Alert for Little River (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 8:18PM CST until February 10 at 3:13PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas...Oklahoma...Texas... Red River Near Dekalb affecting Red River, McCurtain, Bowie and Little River Counties. For the Red River...including Dekalb, Index, Fulton, Springbank Ferry, Shreveport, Coushatta, Grand Ecore...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River Near Dekalb. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.5 feet, Flooding will continue to decrease along the Red River, although bank erosion problems will continue. Minor overflow of low banks will continue, especially on the Oklahoma side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Thursday morning to a crest of 24.8 feet early Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.8 feet on 12/22/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 815 PM CST.
